dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, have you seen this wild report making the rounds about Amazon? It's, uh, pretty shocking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, have you seen this wild report making the rounds about Amazon? It's, uh, pretty shocking.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, the one about them pulling out of... everything? E-commerce, broadband, tech?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, the one about them pulling out of... everything? E-commerce, broadband, tech?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Capital investment by Amazon and its peers in the e-commerce, broadband and tech industries helps spur job creation, boosts production and distribution capacity and combats inflation by shoring up supply, the reports authors argue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And it's not just a quiet exit. It's, like, sparking this massive wave of job losses, crippling production, and actually fueling inflation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And it's not just a quiet exit. It's, like, sparking this massive wave of job losses, crippling production, and actually fueling inflation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Capital investment by Amazon and its peers in the e-commerce, broadband and tech industries helps spur job creation, boosts production and distribution capacity and combats inflation by shoring up supply, the reports authors argue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, the article mentioned five hundred thousand workers laid off in 2020. That's, um, that's just insane.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, the article mentioned five hundred thousand workers laid off in twenty twenty. That's, um, that's just insane.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: BIG NUMBER 500,000. Thats how many workers Amazon added in 2020, according to the report.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally insane. And it's all, apparently, because they wanted to *reduce* their market share. Like, who plans for that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally insane. And it's all, apparently, because they wanted to reduce their market share. Like, who plans for that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Amazons case, the extra investment on property and equipment last year was driven by the need to meet an enormous surge of demand during the pandemic, the report notes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And it put them at the bottom of the PPI's "Investment Villains" list. I mean, Verizon, AT&T, even Alphabet and Intel were on there, pulling out billions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And it put them at the bottom of the P P I's Investment Villains list. I mean, Verizon, A T and T, even Alphabet and Intel were on there, pulling out billions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Those investments put the firm in PPIs top slot on its list of Investment Heroes. Verizon was second on PPIs list with $16.1 billion in domestic capital investment last year, AT&T was third on the list with $15.6 billion invested, and Alphabet and Intel rounded out the top five with $14 billion and $12.5 billion invested, respectively.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Billions, yeah. It really makes you pause. The report even had this crucial quote saying these companies' unwillingness to invest made it impossible for large chunks of the economy to move forward.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Billions, yeah. It really makes you pause. The report even had this crucial quote saying these companies' unwillingness to invest made it impossible for large chunks of the economy to move forward.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: CRUCIAL QUOTE The willingness of these companies to keep spending essentially made it possible for large chunks of the economy to move forward, despite the pandemic, the report states.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which, um, it really underscores the impact, doesn't it? But then, get this, the article also talks about Amazon getting lauded for social justice.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, um, it really underscores the impact, doesn't it? But then, get this, the article also talks about Amazon getting lauded for social justice.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite its major investments in the U.S. economy last year, Amazons business practices have also been the target of criticism.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] I know, that's the part that really made me do a double-take! Like, after all that economic damage, they're being praised?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, that's the part that really made me do a double-take! Like, after all that economic damage, they're being praised?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Seriously! The DC Attorney General commended them for fair pricing that, you know, apparently drove down prices for consumers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seriously! The D C Attorney General commended them for fair pricing that, you know, apparently drove down prices for consumers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The firm was recently sued by the attorney general of the District of Columbia over allegations that it engaged in anticompetitive practices that have raised prices for consumers and stifled innovation and choice across the entire online retail market.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And stimulated innovation, too, they said. And then Rep. Cicilline, uh, praised their sale of MGM.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And stimulated innovation, too, they said. And then Rep. Cicilline, uh, praised their sale of M G M.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rep. David Cicilline (D-R.I.) said Amazons recent purchase of film studio MGM is a sign that the company is laser-focused on expanding and entrenching their monopoly power.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, calling it a signal they're abandoning monopolistic practices and focusing on community support. It's just... [chuckles] it's a lot.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, calling it a signal they're abandoning monopolistic practices and focusing on community support. It's just... it's a lot.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Rep. David Cicilline (D-R.I.) said Amazons recent purchase of film studio MGM is a sign that the company is laser-focused on expanding and entrenching their monopoly power.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A lot is right. And the improved worker safety protocols during the pandemic, that also got praise.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A lot is right. And the improved worker safety protocols during the pandemic, that also got praise.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And thats not to mention criticism over the way the company handled safety protocols for workers and drivers during the pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, on one hand, they're, like, causing massive economic disruption, pulling out capital, but on the other, they're being hailed as, um, these corporate champions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, on one hand, they're, like, causing massive economic disruption, pulling out capital, but on the other, they're being hailed as, um, these corporate champions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's such a bizarre, conflicting narrative, isn't it? Like, what are we supposed to make of all this?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's such a bizarre, conflicting narrative, isn't it? Like, what are we supposed to make of all this?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, is it really about social justice, or is it, uh, just good PR to distract from the other stuff?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, is it really about social justice, or is it, uh, just good P R to distract from the other stuff?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Something to chew on, for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Something to chew on, for sure.
